results.title: Australian women's archival Series
results.brief_description: Each year the Women’s Program of the Australian Film Commission produces an archival interview with a woman who has made a significant contribution to Australia during her lifetime.

results.title: Effective Resumes and Job Applications
results.creator_credit: Louise Welsh Schrank, Learning Seed and Stage Fright Productions
results.brief_description: Learn how to handle job applications and resumes so that you don’t make mistakes that could cost you jobs and money. Let this video show you how to handle resumes, cover letters, and job applications. In today’s competitive job market, this video gives straightforward advice you will appreciate.

results.title: Eclair. Episode 09
results.creator_credit: Alma Gray, David Ash, Pat McLagan and ILEA
results.brief_description: The series “Eclair” features Ted, a rather confused and naive Englishman and a pair of mischievous French adolescent twins. The theme in this film is: “Food and drink - a picnic” using a picnic to introduce the viewer to the names of a range of food, food packaging and French shop names.

results.title: Jacques-Louis David (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Colin Clark, John Brabourne Productions and Visual Programme Systems
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Romantic vs classic art”.
Looks at some famous works of the French artist, Jacques-Louis David, which bear all the strengths and weaknesses of Classicism. Narrated by Kenneth Clark.

results.title: Jean-Auguste Dominique Ingres. No. 1 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Colin Clark, John Brabourne Productions and Visual Programme Systems
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Romantic vs classic art”.
Examines Ingres’ reputation as the archetypal Classic artist and finds it misleading. Ingres escaped completely from orthodox classicism by making direct studies of Greek vases rather than by copying established interpreters. Narrated by Kenneth Clark.

results.title: John Constable
results.creator_credit: Colin Clark, John Brabourne Productions and Visual Programme Systems
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Romantic vs classic art”.
Constable’s greatness lies in his love of nature and his urge to express this love as directly as possible through a faithful transcription of its moods. Written and narrated by Sir Kenneth Clark.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Clark, John Brabourne Productions and Visual Programme Systems

results.title: Jean-Auguste Dominique Ingres. No. 2 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Colin Clark, John Brabourne Productions and Visual Programme Systems
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Romantic vs classic art”.
Ingres was a pure artist, a believer in art for art’s sake. Like Degas, he was obsessed with an ideal of perfect form to which he gave his whole life, but succeeded in capturing it only when the subject was the female nude. Narrated by Kenneth Clark.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Clark, John Brabourne Productions and Visual Programme Systems

results.title: Edge of the World
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Bennett, Kim Moodie, Don Featherstone and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This program looks at the important role the ocean and deserts of Western Australia have played in shaping Tim Winton’s values and beliefs, and how the natural world continues to nourish his creativity as a writer. He stresses the place of landscape in his writing, and the important role nature plays as a counterbalance to the less attractive elements of modern civilisation. As we watch him fishing, he recounts his fascination with the monastic tradition and with individuals who are able to successfully survive alone and away from civilisation - an interesting comment in light of his 2001 novel, “Dirt music”. The documentary includes scenes acted from his novel “Cloudstreet”, and extracts from “The Riders”, “Shallows” and “Scission”, read both by Tim Winton and Hugo Weaving.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Bennett, Kim Moodie, Don Featherstone and Film Australia
